meanings.definition: To try to influence the actions of (someone, especially a public official) by making strong arguments or pleas.
meanings.sent1: The group lobbied the mayor to fix the broken playground.
meanings.sent2: She lobbied her teacher to allow extra credit for the class.
meanings.sent3: The students lobbied for longer recess time, but the principal said no.
meanings.sent4: The parents lobbied for healthier school lunches to nourish the kids.
meanings.sent5: He lobbied passionately for cleaner streets in the neighborhood.

meanings.definition: To seek to influence (a legislator) on an issue.
meanings.sent1: The organization lobbied the senator to support the new bill.
meanings.sent2: They lobbied hard for stricter environmental regulations.
meanings.sent3: The cat lobbied for more treats by purring loudly near the treat jar.
meanings.sent4: The team lobbied the coach for more practice time to improve their skills.
meanings.sent5: She lobbied the council member to allocate funds for a community garden.
